paragraphs.content: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?

paragraphs.content: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the LORD, and against his anointed, saying,
paragraphs.contentHtml: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the Lord, and against his anointed, saying,

paragraphs.content: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.

paragraphs.content: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.

paragraphs.content: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.

paragraphs.content: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.

paragraphs.content: I will declare the decree: the LORD hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will declare the decree: the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.

paragraphs.content: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

paragraphs.content: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

paragraphs.content: Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Serve the Lord with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

paragraphs.content: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.
